results.title: Malaya speaks
results.brief_description: An account of the varied services provided by Radio Malaya, which broadcasts programs of entertainment, information, and education in several languages to a listening public of many different races, age-groups and tastes. Besides news, general entertainment and school programs, Radio Malaya broadcasts programs designed to teach people to read, and many programs of special interest to rural communities.

results.title: Malaya posting
results.brief_description: Australian overseas army personnel in Malaya. The contrasts of old and new in this multi-racial Asian country; surrender barracks and the facilities for servicemen’s families; training in jungle warfare, tropical first aid; transport in the jungle; sports and places to visit in leisure time. Australia’s servicemen as ambassadors.

results.title: Malaya
results.brief_description: A short impression of Malaya and its peoples, the film opens with scenes on the island of Penang, then tin mining near Kuala Lumpur is shown, with the remaining section of the film being concerned with Singapore.

results.title: Malawi: two young men
results.creator_credit: Churchill Films, Dimension Films and Max Reid
results.brief_description: After completing school, two friends are faced with the problem of finding a place in Malawian society. They are shown in an unsuccessful attempt to become middlemen, buying and smoking fish, then selling them at an inland market. Failing, they go to a city where they spend days seeking work. Unemployment, high cost of living and unfriendly people sends one of the two back to his village.

results.title: Malawi: the women
results.creator_credit: Churchill Films, Dimension Films and Max Reid
results.brief_description: The varying lifestyles of Malawian women are revealed through sequences showing them at work in a village, a city, and the suburbs of a city. Two women voice their views about their respective lives and these reflect the concerns of many at the contrasts of village and city life.

results.title: Malacca: then and now
results.brief_description: Shows Malacca, a small port in Malaya with a long history, including relics of the Hindus, Muslims, Portugese, Dutch and British. Provides glimpses of the religious traditions brought by these peoples, as well as the ancient funeral ceremonies of the Chinese. Claims that Malacca shows how Eastern and Western ways of life can settle down tolerantly together.

results.title: Making yourself understood: introduction to communication
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and John T. Bobbitt
results.brief_description: Language written or spoken, is our principle tool of communication. Essentials for communication - communicator, content, medium, audience, response. Knowing the type of audience being addressed is essential to getting your message across, and to getting the response you desire.

results.title: Making your presentation
results.brief_description: This program has been prepared specifically to help young people overcome their nerves and fears in speaking in public and, instead, make a presentation that is entertaining and rewarding. Students are introduced to some of the techniques used by professional presenters, including: planning and researching your topic; writing and timing your presentation; using confident body languauge, eye to eye contact and voice; using visual aids and handouts. Study guide included.
